channel.title: Minecraft Classic
channel.description: Is there any way someone would be able to create and executable version for Minecraft Classic?

item.title: Minecraft Classic
item.dc:creator: @Kurisu Kurisu
item.description:
@Kurisu wrote:

It runs smoother for me and I could use it just for creations and such

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

While I’m working on it, may I ask why you want minecraft classic and not full?

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft Classic
item.dc:creator: @Kurisu Kurisu
item.description:
@Kurisu wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:4, topic:399007”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=496143.msg3627180#msg3627180 date=1307923958]
That jar isnt stored on your computer?
[/quote]
No, not for classic, it was all packed into the same JAR file and launched via the web.

@Topic - I’ll see what I can do for ya, might take writing a frame and embedding it, but I’ll see lol.

EDIT: Incase you anybody wants to take a crack at it before I do, here is the list of used JAR and LZMA files. I didn’t check for doubles or anything, I just had a script fish them from the page for me:

[code]
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/lwjgl_applet.jar.pack.lzma
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/lwjgl.jar.pack.lzma
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/jinput.jar.pack.lzma
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/lwjgl_util.jar.pack.lzma
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/minecraft.jar
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/lwjgl_util_applet.jar
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/lzma.jar

https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/windows_natives.jar.lzma
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/linux_natives.jar.lzma
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/macosx_natives.jar.lzma
https://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftDownload/classic/solaris_natives.jar.lzma
[/code][/quote]
Thanks mate

Read full topic

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

badger41:

That jar isnt stored on your computer?

No, not for classic, it was all packed into the same JAR file and launched via the web.

@Topic - I’ll see what I can do for ya, might take writing a frame and embedding it, but I’ll see lol.

EDIT: Incase you anybody wants to take a crack at it before I do, here is the list of used JAR and LZMA files. I didn’t check for doubles or anything, I just had a script fish them from the page for me:
